bestBHT.bht: Let all slaves under the yoke honor their masters, both unbelieving and believing, with all fitting honor, recognizing them as their own masters whom they should not despise or disrespect. This exhortation is given to prevent the name of God and his doctrine from being spoken evil of, as it is expected that Christian slaves would conduct themselves in an honorable manner towards their masters. By serving faithfully and showing honor, they demonstrate their commitment to the gospel and defend the reputation of God and his teachings.

bhtAttempts.bht: Let all those who are slaves humbly regard their masters with honor and respect, recognizing that they belong to them. This exhortation is especially important for Christian slaves who may be tempted to feel superior to their heathen masters. By showing honor and serving faithfully, they can prevent the name of God and his doctrine from being spoken evil of. It is crucial for these slaves to remember that their conduct should reflect their belief in God and his teachings. When slaves count their masters as worthy of all honor, both inwardly and outwardly, they demonstrate their commitment to the gospel and prevent any blasphemy against God's name.
